author: redbeardlegoman
title: What's up, Doc?
review:
Sometimes I think about MOCs I would like to make, and thereby CMFs I would like to see.  I had never thought about a vet's clinic until now.

And that, I think, is what makes the CMFs so great in general.  They can so easily inspire us to create new scenes.  They are wonderful seed parts.

I love the hair.  It helps the minifigure bear a striking resemblance to Jennifer Anniston (though that could lead to a "Friends" tv show MOC... shudder...).  The vet printing on light aqua, with dual moulded arms and blue hands is top shelf.  I only hope that a plain light aqua leg assembly comes out, so I can use the torso for more hospital scenes.  For now, I can just hope no one sees the paw print on their doctor's badge.

The bunny!  I LOVE the bunny!  I think it will be better suited to a Monty Python and The Holy Grail MOC than the cutesy Friends line bunny.  And I'm that much closer to my Zoo, now with a Petting Zoo section, and it's own, on staff vets.

author: Odeinoichus
title: And now I shall pull a Rabbit from my hat.
review:
Set #71018 Veterinarian: LEGO loves to give us newly sculpted animal pieces with the CMF series and Series 17 is no exception.

Our Veterinarian has some nice scrubs on, meaning she's dressed in typical nurse or doctor clothes with some nice printed detailing, a stethoscope draped around her neck, a small nametag attached to her leg with a nice paw print. She has dual-molded arms featuring a unique new colour, I'm fairly sure this very light green (or teal possibly) hasn't been seen before.

And of course for an accessory she includes a cute little bunny rabbit. The rabbit differs from the LEGO Friends animal by featuring a different pose, less stylized Heartlake City looking curves and the style matches up with other LEGO animal pieces. A great new creature and an accessory that bumps up the desirability and demand of this figure in my opinion.

This one is strongly recommended from this Series. As you can see I picked up three, definitely think more than that would make a great LEGO City Farm rabbit population, or park if you prefer. Strongly Recommended.
